programme.desc: "The Mystery of the Haunted Crossing" - In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.desc: Matt and Chris are hoping to turn their seasons around by joining up with Cody Lee and family in Texas at Sand Creek Whitetails.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E12 "Breaking Down the Hunt, Josh’s Best Lesson"
programme.desc: On this week's episode we start off by joining multiple members of the team as they fill their turkey tags. Then we join Bill, who breaks down the hunt for the massive buck he harvested back in 2016 that he called "Lefty." Next we join Josh Sparks who discusses the best lesson he's learned over his last 4 years of hunting.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E13 "Big Bucks on Permission, Poor Man Plot Success"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we start off with Bill who shows how successful one of the Poor Man Plots he put in last season is doing. He covers the steps he took to make the plot and offers tips so you can make one of your own. Then we join Josh Sparks who lays out the plans for a food plot that he and Kaleb Greiner are creating using this poor man style. Finally, we join Jared Mills on a throwback hunt as he covers some of the biggest challenges that come with hunting big deer on permission. Jared also offers creative advice on how to gain permission for hunting.

programme.title: "On Deck" With Captain Cory McGuire
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late." Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.desc: Zeke Nantz is hunting a central Kentucky cattle farm where he howls in a pair of coyotes.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E11 "Tag Teaming a Coyote Double - Coyote Hunting"
programme.desc: Join in on a central Kentucky coyote stand. Jon's little brother Phil Collins is visiting from Wyoming and they end up having an awesome hunt where they knock down 2 coyotes!

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E12 "Calling For Bobcats - Bobcat Hunting"
programme.desc: We sure love calling for bobcats and that's exactly what we're doing on this hunt! Join Jon and Phil Collins on a central Kentucky bobcat stand.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E13 "Coyote Quad - Coyote Hunting"
programme.desc: Coyote Quad!!! That's right! 4 coyotes go down on the same stand! Join Jon Collins and Corey Hager on an unforgettable hunt in central Kentucky.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E14 "Deer Vs Coyotes"
programme.desc: Right here is something you don't see everyday! On this hunt Jon Collins finds 2 coyotes harassing a whitetail deer. Watch to see how this hunt unfolds!

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E15 "Following Coyote Tracks"
programme.desc: On this hunt Jon Collins and Zeke Nantz are making a bobcat stand, but while walking in they discover coyote tracks everywhere. Let's see what comes to the call.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E16 "River Bottom Coyote"

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Eric O Shea - Life: It's Not Your Fault
programme.desc: Eric O'Shea has been active in the comedy business for 25 years. He has performed in L.A. with Betty White at the Creative Emmy Awards and has appeared on America's Got Talent TV Show. Every year since 1997, Eric has performed an average of 70 shows a year, and has received 7 nominations as the “National College Comedian of the Year”

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Shayne Smith - Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Former Gang Member, current comedian, future famous comedian. Shayne Smith is the runner up in the Wiseguys’ 2015 Funniest Person In Utah competition, winner of the 2015 Salt City Comedy Superstar contest and most recently voted best Alternative Comedian of 2016 by City Weekly.

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight
programme.desc: The christian comic is married to his high school sweetheart, who later became his stepsister through the marriage of their parents to each other. That’s where the fun begins as Moody skillfully shares his life experiences.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Christopher Lawrence - Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Mark Christopher Lawrence (born May 22, 1964) is an American character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist. He is perhaps best known for his role as esoteric D.J., Tone Deaf, in the 1994 satirical rap mockumentary, Fear of a Black Hat. He has co-starred in popular films such as Terminator 2: Judgment Day, Planet of the Apes, Lost Treasure and The Pursuit of Happiness. Lawrence can currently be seen in his regular role as Big Mike on the NBC series Chuck. He has made guest appearances on many television programs, most notably Heroes, My Name Is Earl, Crossing Jordan, Dharma & Greg, Malcolm in the Middle, Touched by an Angel, Malcolm & Eddie, Men Behaving Badly, Seinfeld, Murphy Brown, and Martin. He is also featured on the Radio Series Adventures in Odyssey as "Ed Washington".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Don Barnhart - The Spinal Disintegration of Man

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Karen Morgan - Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: A former trial attorney, she moved from the courtroom to comedy after being selected as a Finalist on Nickelodeon TV’s Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Maija DiGiorgio - Maija Pinion
programme.desc: Born to a black mother and an Italian father in New York City, Maija Digiorgios comedy centers on the examination of her own mixed-race identity. Digiorgio riffs on Thanksgiving with each side of her family, gender roles between the two cultlures, and her racist grandma in this special.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Doug Thompson - Who Taught You What?

programme.title: We Used to Eat Animals the Right Way - Here's What Changed
programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. Our brains grew significantly once the human race started hunting its food. Diets that consisted of blood, guts, and organs contributed to that growth. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.
